title: Dentists to get cash incentives for NHS patients
description: The government is preparing to offer dentists cash incentives to take on extra NHS patients, and send teams to schools to treat children's teeth. Under a plan to boost services in England seen by the BBC, dentists will receive a "bonus" to take on more NHS patients.

title: Government to review ministers’ severance payouts but rejects immediate reform
description: Cabinet Office minister Esther McVey said the principle of making “reasonable” payments “remains sound” given ministers can be removed at any time, telling MPs: “The Government doesn’t currently intend to reform severance pay for departing ministers, although I am happy to review it.”

title: Torfaen councillors told budget 'will be the envy of Wales'
description: RISKS around energy prices and pay increases are concerning councillors in Torfean – which is preparing a budget “likely to be the envy” of many Welsh councils. The council’s funding from the Welsh Government is set to increase by 3.24 per cent for the 2024/25 financial year which is above the Welsh average of 3.1 per cent it been planning for.

title: Federal Reserve official says hot labour market will not derail plans for interest rate cuts
description: A top Federal Reserve official has insisted that the US’s hot labour market is continuing to cool, in a sign that last month’s unexpectedly strong employment numbers will not derail plans by rate setters to cut borrowing costs this year.

title: Tories losing next week's by-election will be 'tipping point' for 'seismic' election defeat, Nadine Dorries tells LBC
description: The Tories losing next week's by-election in Wellingborough will act as a 'tipping point' before the party faces a 'seismic' electoral wipeout, Nadine Dorries has told LBC.

title: Recruitment Video: Employment Ministry denies receiving request for recruitment in Canada
description: The Ministry of Employment and Labour Relations has denounced a video circulating online that alleges a Ghanaian woman was denied authorisation to recruit labour for jobs in Canada.

title: How I wish I’d grown up in a time without the internet
description: Generation X, the cohort born roughly between 1965 and 1980, stands as the final generation to truly comprehend life without the incessant presence of a smartphone or computer screen. In today’s MetroTalk, a Gen-Z (1997 – 2012) reader expresses nostalgia for an era untouched by the pervasive influence of internet-induced ‘brain rot.’

title: Asda billionaire brothers infuriate locals with plans for five 'monstrous McMansions'

title: Labour politicians Angela Rayner and Anas Sarwar visit East Lothian
description: Angela Rayner, deputy leader of UK Labour, and Anas Sarwar, Scottish Labour leader, joined Douglas Alexander, the party’s candidate for the East Lothian constituency, and South Scotland MSP Martin Whitfield in Prestonpans and at Glenkinchie Distillery, near Pencaitland, on Friday.

title: Trafford Council to press on with £76.5m 'New Carrington' road
description: A council said it planned to press on with an "essential" £76.5m relief road. The 'New Carrington' road in Trafford, which was first proposed more than a decade ago, is aimed at cutting traffic congestion on the single existing road in and out of the area.

title: Senedd's Covid-19 committee 'not fit for purpose'
description: Bereaved families have described a Senedd Covid-19 committee as “not fit for any purpose” amid concerns about duplication and a lack of engagement.

title: Lib Dems announce candidate to fight Lewisham Mayoral by-elections
description: Former councillor Chris Maines has been announced as the Liberal Democrat candidate for the forthcoming mayoral by-election following Damien Egan’s resignation earlier this month. Mr Maines – who works for the NHS – is a former Lewisham councillor and has lived in Blackheath for almost 20 years.
